intro: Crepis pallens, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are basal and pinnately divided, while the flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular florets. Crepis pallens is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
